quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Only those who attempt the absurd can achieve the impossible.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You are never too old to set another goal, or to dream a new dream.
author: Les Brown

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Les Brown

quote: Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
author: Les Brown

quote: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

quote: You don't have to be great to get started, but you have to get started to be great.
author: Les Brown

quote: Life has no limitations, except the ones you make.
author: Les Brown

quote: Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.
author: Les Brown

quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The most important decisions you make are not the things you do, but the things you decide not to do.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Let's go invent tomorrow rather than worrying about what happened yesterday.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Always do what you are afraid to do.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I've missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times I've been trusted to take the game-winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

quote: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
author: Socrates

quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

quote: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

quote: The more you know, the more you realize you don't know.
author: Aristotle

quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
author: Confucius

quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

quote: I am what time, circumstance, history, have made of me, certainly, but I am also, much more than that. So are we all.
author: James Baldwin

quote: People who shut their eyes to reality simply invite their own destruction.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The purpose of art is to lay bare the questions that have been hidden by the answers.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The place in which I'll fit will not exist until I make it.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The preservation of health should be the first study of one who is of any worth to oneself.
author: René Descartes

quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
author: René Descartes

quote: To live without philosophizing is in truth the same as keeping the eyes closed without attempting to open them.
author: René Descartes

quote: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries.
author: René Descartes

quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
author: René Descartes

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

quote: An empty vessel makes the loudest sound, so they that have the least wit are the greatest babblers.
author: Plato

quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The truth of a theory can never be proven, for one never knows if future experience will contradict its conclusions.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science without epistemology is—insofar as it is thinkable at all—primitive and muddled.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
author: Edwin Hubble

quote: The history of astronomy is a history of receding horizons.
author: Edwin Hubble

quote: Science is the one human activity that is truly progressive. The body of positive knowledge is transmitted from generation to generation.
author: Edwin Hubble

quote: The universe is unfolding as it should.
author: Edwin Hubble

quote: Past time is finite, future time is infinite.
author: Edwin Hubble

quote: To a clear eye the smallest fact is a window through which the infinite may be seen.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: The known is finite, the unknown infinite; intellectually we stand on an islet in the midst of an illimitable ocean of inexplicability. Our business in every generation is to reclaim a little more land.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion, follow humbly wherever and to whatever abysses nature leads, or you shall learn nothing.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Measure what can be measured, and make measurable what cannot be measured.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Where the senses fail us, reason must step in.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: The truth may be puzzling… but our preferences do not determine what's true.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: The Earth is a very small stage in a vast cosmic arena.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries.
author: René Descartes

quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
author: René Descartes

quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
author: René Descartes

quote: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
author: René Descartes

quote: It is not enough to possess a good mind; it must be applied.
author: René Descartes

quote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The first requisite for success is the ability to apply your physical and mental energies to one problem incessantly without growing weary.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: I never did a day's work in my life, it was all fun.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison
